thread.title: CONCACAF Champions League Review: Knockout stage set as Tigres advance
thread.title_full: CONCACAF Champions League Review: Knockout stage set as Tigres advance

author: Get Ready for an Earthquake, NASA Tells L.A.
title: CONCACAF Champions League Review: Knockout stage set as Tigres advance
text:
CONCACAF Champions League Review: Knockout stage set as Tigres advance Goal.com 12 hrs ago © Provided by Goal.com Tigres booked their spot in the CONCACAF Champions League knockout stage despite a 0-0 draw against Herediano on Wednesday, setting up four matchups between Liga MX clubs and MLS teams in next year's quarterfinals.
AdChoices Ricardo Ferretti's men were unable to find a breakthrough in the Group B clash, but a draw was enough. With the point, the Mexican side topped the group – finishing three points clear of Herediano and five ahead of Isidro Metapan.
Elsewhere, the already-qualified LA Galaxy completed their group stage slate with a 1-1 draw at Comunicaciones.
Alan Gordon appeared to give the MLS side victory — and the knockout round's top seed — with his scrappy 84th-minute goal. But the Galaxy conceded in additional time when Rolando Blackburn struck at the back post, dropping Bruce Arena's team to the fifth seed.
The Galaxy finished on eight points, four clear of Central and Comunicaciones.
Here are the quarterfinal matchups:
No. 1 Club America vs. No. 8 Seattle Sounders No. 2 D.C. United vs. No. 7 Queretaro No. 3 Real Salt Lake vs. No. 6 Tigres No. 4 Santos Laguna vs. No. 5 LA Galaxy
The two-leg quarterfinals are scheduled for Feb. 23-25 and March 1-3, while the semifinals are set for March 15-17 and April 5-7. The final is expected to be held in late April.
